definition: the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
the benevolent man cannot be rich and vice versa (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
pinyin: wei2 fu4 bu4 ren2 , wei2 ren2 bu4 fu4

sentences.english: Hurstwood seemed more apathetic than ever.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎比以前更显得麻木不仁。
是的，监狱让你麻木不仁。

sentences.english: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies or the wicked are cruel.
sentences.chinese: 义人顾惜牲畜的生命主，恶人都是残暴不仁。

sentences.english: That the numbed armies of fear cannot destory.
sentences.chinese: 即便是麻木不仁的恐惊之军也无法摧毁。

sentences.english: I felt ashamed for the callousness of the government in tackling land speculation.
sentences.chinese: 对于政府处理地产投机态度麻木不仁，我引以为耻。

sentences.english: Once in a while, a tragedy occurs which touches even the most case-hardened heart.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧不时发生，连那些麻木不仁的人们也有所触动。

sentences.english: Because of unfeeling and obstinacy, my heart will hardly open.
sentences.chinese: 由于麻木不仁和固执，我心将难以敞开。

sentences.english: I've never known anyone as insensitive as Gina.
sentences.chinese: 我从未见过像吉娜那样麻木不仁的人。

sentences.english: As soon as you thought own love love history, can cry one's heart out, numb.
sentences.chinese: 沵一想到自己旳爱情史，会痛哭流涕，麻木不仁。

sentences.english: An evil rich man is like a poor man with treasure.
sentences.chinese: 仅管坐拥金山，却为富不仁，这是藏宝穷人。

sentences.english: Seeing too much violence on television can desensitize people to it.
sentences.chinese: 在电视上看太多暴力，会使人对暴力麻木不仁。

sentences.english: But a rising wave of anger is directed against the new "malefactors of great wealth".
sentences.chinese: 然而新的一轮怒潮正扑向新一代的为富不仁者。

sentences.english: Only the rich and arrogant had dogs and allowed them to bite poor people, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: 只有为富不仁的人才养狗来咬穷人，”他说。

sentences.english: I didn't realize I was being an insensitive clod .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道原来我是这么一个麻木不仁的笨蛋。
他想，这是不仁不义的事儿。

sentences.english: Scream about it. Just don’t go back to being numb.
sentences.chinese: 就是不要再麻木不仁地对待它。

definition: completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless
the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
rebels and traitors (idiom)/general term for scoundrel
to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
